thread.title: The Latest: Lawyer vows to appeal dismissed Jay Z lawsuit
thread.title_full: The Latest: Lawyer vows to appeal dismissed Jay Z lawsuit

title: The Latest: Lawyer vows to appeal dismissed Jay Z lawsuit
text:
The latest on a copyright infringement case against rapper Jay Z (all times local): 
10:27 a.m. 
A judge has dismissed a copyright infringement case against rapper Jay Z over his 1999 hit "Big Pimpin'" before the case was sent to a jury. 
U.S. District Judge Christina A. Snyder ruled Wednesday that the heir of an Egyptian composer didn't have the right to pursue a copyright infringement claim and the case should be tossed out. 
The nephew of Baligh Hamdi, an Egyptian composer whose 1957 song "Khosara Khosara" is partially used in "Big Pimpin'," sued Jay Z and producer Timbaland. Flute notes that Hamdi composed appear throughout the Jay Z song. 
The abrupt end to the case came after the rapper and Timbaland testified about creating the rap hit and their belief that they had valid rights to use the Egyptian song. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WPXI-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
